block.p: Steak Class

A cooking class on selecting and preparing steak will be held, with a tasting lunch, on Saturday from noon to 2 p.m. at Nick & Stef's Steakhouse, 9 Penn Plaza (33rd Street, between Seventh and Eighth Avenues). The cost is $75: (212) 563-4444.
Poets on the Menu

To celebrate National Poetry Month, starting this week, a number of restaurants, including Blue Hill, Lupa and Riverdale Garden, will feature menu poems, menus written by poets. The campaign has been organized by Alimentum: The Literature of Food, a quarterly of food writing, and a list of the participating restaurants is available at alimentumjournal.com. On Monday at 7 p.m. there will be a reading of the menu poems at the Tagine Dining Gallery, 537 Ninth Avenue (40th Street): (212) 564-7292.
Wisconsin Cheddars

A class about Wisconsin Cheddar cheeses, with a tasting including wine, will be held from 6:30 to 8 p.m. Monday in the classroom at Murray's Cheese Shop, 254 Bleecker Street (Cornelia Street). The cost is $50: (212) 243-3289, extension 12.
Food and Gardening in Schools

An all-day conference about food and gardening in schools run by the Baum Forum, which periodically examines food and agricultural issues, will be held on April 21 from 8:30 a.m. to 6 p.m. at Teachers College, Columbia University, Broadway and 120th Street. The program will include a lunch prepared by Jorge Leon Collazo, the executive chef of the New York City public schools. Tickets are $30 for students, $65 for regular admission, and $100, which includes a $35 donation to a scholarship fund to the conference for those who cannot afford the fee. Advance registration is required: (718) 884-5716 or baumforum.org.
Cookware Sale

Kate Humphrey will close her cookware shop, the Art of Cooking, 555 Hudson Street (Perry Street), on April 22 to concentrate on her Web site, artofcookingnyc.com. Until then, most of the merchandise in the store is on sale at a 50 percent reduction.
Benefits

Action Against Hunger, an international humanitarian relief group that works to combat malnutrition and provide clean water, has started a month-long campaign. Restaurants around the country will donate money, and ask their customers to add at least $1 as a donation to their dining check. The group will hold a tasting of foods from 17 restaurants, including Dawat and Falai, tomorrow from 8 p.m. to midnight at the Altman Building, 135 West 18th Street. Tickets are $75, or $250 for early admission and a reception where guests can meet the chefs: (212) 967-7800, extension 117, or restaurantsagainsthunger.net. Information on the participating restaurants is available at the Web site.

A tasting of food and wine from around the world will be held tomorrow from 7 to 10 p.m. in the concourse at Chelsea Market, 75 Ninth Avenue (15th Street), to benefit the Cystic Fibrosis Foundation. Tickets are $250, or $750 to include a reception from 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. at which Mario Batali will serve handmade salumi. Tickets: (212) 986-8783 or manhattan.cff.org.
A tasting of three tequilas, three tequila cocktails and three tacos will be held tomorrow at 6 p.m. at ZÃ³calo, 174 East 82nd Street, to benefit City Harvest. The fee is $10: (212) 717-7772.

The proceeds of a cocktail party with experts like Gary Regan and Leo DeGroff mixing the drinks to be held on Monday from 5:30 to 7:30 p.m. at Sambuca, 20 West 72nd Street, will provide desks for children in a village school in Mauritania. For tickets, $33: myspace.com/educateaboutafrica.

City Harvest will hold its 25th anniversary gala, the Practical Magic Ball, on April 18 at 6:30 p.m. at Cipriani 42nd Street, 110 East 42nd Street. For tickets, $750 and up: (917) 351-8725. As part of the celebration, restaurants around the city will donate 25 percent of the price of certain dishes on their menus during the month of April. For information on the event and the participating restaurants: cityharvest.org.

A tasting of Portuguese wines, with food from Portuguese restaurants in the region, will be held on April 19 from 5:30 to 8 p.m., with a tasting seminar at 6:30 p.m., in the Lighthouse at Chelsea Piers, 23rd Street and the Hudson River, to benefit Slow Food USA. For tickets, $35: (212) 929-7700.

Taste of the Nation, the Share Our Strength events that are held in scores of cities to benefit hunger relief for children, will hold a tasting on April 23 from 6 to 9 p.m. in the Westin Princeton at Forrestal Village, Princeton, N.J. For tickets, $85 in advance, $95 at the door: (877) 268-2783 or princetontaste.org. The New York City event will be held on May 23; tickets are not yet available. A complete schedule of events is available at taste.strength.org.
